## Potential Rules for Ptn in Cancer Associated Fibroblasts (CAFs) Here are some potential rules for Ptn in CAFs, along with justifications based on the provided documents: **Rule 1:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases α-SMA expression. **Justification:** Ptn is a known activator of CAFs, and α-SMA is a key marker of myofibroblast differentiation, a hallmark of CAF activation. [Document 33, 54, 60, 61, 62, 66, 68, 70, 72, 73, 74] **Rule 2:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases TGF-β receptor 2 (TGFβR2) expression. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to promote the differentiation of AT-MSCs into CAFs, which is mediated by the TGFβR2 pathway. [Document 33] **Rule 3:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of CXCL12. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete CXCL12, a chemokine that attracts CD4+CD25+ T lymphocytes and promotes their differentiation into CD25HighFOXP3High regulatory T cells. [Document 21, 68, 74] **Rule 4:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of CCL2. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete CCL2, a chemokine that attracts macrophages and promotes their polarization towards the M2 phenotype. [Document 22, 30, 36, 54, 56, 68, 70] **Rule 5:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of CCL5. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete CCL5, a chemokine that attracts macrophages and promotes their polarization towards the M2 phenotype. [Document 22, 30, 36, 54, 56, 68, 70] **Rule 6:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of IL-6. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete IL-6, a cytokine that promotes tumor growth and metastasis. [Document 21, 22, 36, 44, 54, 56, 68, 70, 73] **Rule 7:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of IL-8. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete IL-8, a cytokine that promotes tumor growth and metastasis. [Document 22, 36, 44, 54, 56, 68, 70, 73] **Rule 8:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of VEGF. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete VEGF, a cytokine that promotes angiogenesis. [Document 22, 36, 44, 54, 56, 68, 70, 73] **Rule 9:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of MMP-2. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete MMP-2, a protease that degrades the extracellular matrix and promotes tumor invasion. [Document 22, 28, 29, 36, 44, 54, 55, 56, 58, 62, 68, 70, 73] **Rule 10:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of MMP-9. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete MMP-9, a protease that degrades the extracellular matrix and promotes tumor invasion. [Document 22, 28, 29, 36, 44, 54, 55, 56, 58, 62, 68, 70, 73] **Rule 11:** In cancer associated fibroblasts, Ptn increases the secretion of MMP-13. **Justification:** Ptn has been shown to activate CAFs, which in turn secrete MMP-13, a protease that degrades the extracellular matrix and promotes tumor invasion.
